com.example.hotpot0.models

Class EventDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.hotpot0.models.EventDB

  • public class EventDB
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles all Firestore database operations related to Event.

    This class encapsulates methods to add, update, delete, and fetch events, as well as to modify participant-related arrays (linkIDs, sampledIDs, cancelledIDs).

    Each method is asynchronous and uses callback interfaces to return results or report failures to the caller.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  EventDB.GetCallback<T>
      Generic callback interface for asynchronous Firestore operations.

    • Constructor Summary

      Initializes the EventDB instance and Firestore connection.

        Parameters:

        isRequired - true if geolocation verification is required
        callback - callback indicating completion status

      • sampleEvent

        public void sampleEvent(Event event,
                        EventDB.GetCallback<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> callback)
        Randomly samples new participants for an event based on its waitlist.

        This method first retrieves the list of users on the waitlist using EventUserLinkDB.getWaitListUsers(List, EventUserLinkDB.GetCallback). Once the waitlist is obtained, it calls Event.sampleParticipants(List) to randomly select participants up to the event's capacity and updates Firestore with the new sampledIDs.

        Parameters:
        event - the Event object for which participants are being sampled
        callback - the callback invoked upon success or failure; onSuccess returns the list of sampled participant IDs

      • fillEmptySampledSpots

        public void fillEmptySampledSpots(Event event,
                                  EventDB.GetCallback<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> callback)
        Fills empty sampled participant slots for an event using its waitlist. Updates Firestore with the newly added sampled participants.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to update
        callback - callback returning the newly sampled participant IDs
